intro: Hieracium cinderella, commonly known as the cinderella groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and rough, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that can reach up to 30 cm in height, with a fibrous root system. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
